intro: Hesperanthes, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It is native to the Hawaiian Islands and consists of several species, including Hesperanthes sandwicensis. The plants are shrubs or small trees with showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. They have heart-shaped leaves and produce capsule fruits containing seeds. Hesperanthes species are adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii and play an important role in the local ecosystem.
